nodes.text: A female officer from the Core Worlds location Alsakan served in the First Order's High Command. Following the takeover of the Corellian Engineering Corporation by the First Order, she undertook Winshur Bratt's re-employment interview, who was the company's head clerk in the Records Department. In 34 ABY, the officer delivered a message to Bratt, informing him of an important task that needed to be completed.

Hailing from Alsakan, a location in the Core Worlds, the female officer served the First Order as a member of their High Command. After the First Order took over the Corellian Engineering Corporation, the employees at the company were interviewed to determine if they could keep their jobs. The officer undertook the re-employment interview of Winshur Bratt, who was employed as the head clerk of the company's Records Department, with Bratt retaining his job. She told him he was exactly the kind of citizen that the First Order was searching for.

In 34 ABY, the woman delivered a message to Bratt, who was now the First Order's Executive Records Officer, in the form of a hologram, informing him that he was tasked with overseeing the placement of prisoners arriving on the planet in the Corellian shipyards labor pool. After transferring three confidential documents which contained the names of the prisoners over to him, she detailed the information in the documents and added that successful completion of the task would see him transferred to high command, before closing the hologram.

During Bratt's re-employment interview, the officer saw great potential in him, believing that he could potentially join the High Command in the future if he completed his assignment successfully. Bratt thought of the woman as "relentlessly ordered."
The officer wore a gray First Order military uniform.
The officer appeared in Resistance Reborn, a 2019 novel written by Rebecca Roanhorse.
